Detection of a process exhibiting unusua.Action: Identify processes creating child processes using Windows Event ID 4688. Analyze parent-child process relationships. Use frequency analysis or statistical scoring to identify rare or anomalous parent-child process combinations that could indicate injection.

A process exhibiting behavior inconsiste.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) for specific processes known to be targeted by injection. Analyze command-line arguments or spawned processes initiated by these targeted processes for deviations from their normal behavior using behavioral baselines and statistical scoring.

Detection of a process commonly targeted.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 4689
Detection of a process commonly targeted.Action: Analyze Windows Event ID 4689 (Process Termination) for unexpected termination of critical system or security processes. Correlate terminations with preceding unusual activity captured by Windows Event ID 4688 from those processes.

A process initiating suspicious network.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for connections initiated by processes identified as potentially injected via analysis of Windows Event IDs. Use correlation analysis to link unusual network activity to specific process IDs or user sessions observed in host logs. Use time series analysis to detect spikes or deviations in network traffic volume or destination ports from these processes.
